Title: Determine if phrases make sense, are grammatically correct, and are true.
Description: Determine if phrases make sense and is grammatically correct, and if they are true or false.
phrase1: Use some soap and water to clean up.
phrase2: one can keep their hands clean with gloves while working
phrase3: You may want to bring an umbrella to walk under incase it rains.
phrase4: A customer might write a check for the shirt using a checkbook
phrase5: You can carry sweet delight in a sac.
Template:
Thanks for participating in this HIT!

You will:

  1. Read a short phrase.
  2. Determine if the phrase makes sense and is grammatically correct.
  3. Determine if the phrase is true or false.
    • Use the legend below to guide your answers:
    trueGenerally true.
    falseGenerally untrue.
    unclearUnclear - phrase makes sense, but isn't generally true or untrue.
1)
Many people use a wallet to hold their money.

b)
Is it true or false?

Is it true or false?
3)

a)
Does this phrase make sense? Is it grammatically correct?
b)
Is it true or false?
4)
I use scissors to cut out the vouchers.
a)
Does this phrase make sense? Is it grammatically correct?
b)
Is it true or false?
5)
Need gas to ru.
a)
Does this phrase make sense? Is it grammatically correct?
b)
Is it true or false?
